p:
Food-borne pathogenic bacteria have been considered as the main causes of food-borne infections in worldwide.
1, 2 Among food pathogens, Listeria monocytogenes is the only species of the genus Listeria that has been involved in known food-borne outbreaks of listeriosis and causing 10% to 40% mortality in patients.
1, 3, 4
L monocytogenes is ubiquitous and can grow in high salt concentrations (10%), at a wide range of temperatures (1°C-45°C), at pH 4.6 to 9.6 and can be found in raw products of animal origin and fresh vegetables.
5 Also, the contamination could happen in processed food through contaminated waters and environments as well as during transportation.
